channel.title: Which linux OS should I use?
channel.description:
Ok I know this is the most pitiful question here, but I am asking it :).
Which Linux OS is better for RAM usage, like for hosting or running things with out lag on a 54 Mb connection?
I know I should rephrase this so here goes, Which Linux OS is best for running many programs at once like high CPU stuff ( No not a lot of porn -.- I don't watch porn :) ), I was thinking a Linux server OS But I am not sure what to use, really I am trying to say I want to take full advantage of my computer use as much as I can with out the OS taking like 2 Gbs of RAM -.- or using up a lot of space on my hard drive.
Note: I know this is a pitiful question. :)

item.title: Which linux OS should I use?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

All linux distros run on the linux kernel and should use the same amount of RAM if you run the same programs on them. So a better question to ask, is do you want to run extra programs that make your life as a server administrator easier? If you are going to use this as a desktop, you will want a window manager, and therefore I would recommend Xubuntu (runs xfce, it’s light, if you want lighter, use fluxbox). If this is just a server, accessed via ssh, I would recommend debian stable, and only install what you need.

Read full topic
item.source: Which linux OS should I use?

item.title: Which linux OS should I use?
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Arch Linux
You choose what shit you want to install; not the installer therefore you get a minimalist OS which is way superior to Xubuntu.

On the other hand if you want to preserve as much RAM and CPU usage you will have to run an OS via command line so you can use Xubuntu and switch off X Window system or just use Arch without installing any unessential packages (Which is even better)

Read full topic
item.source: Which linux OS should I use?
